alert.note: Alert for Foothills of the Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Air Stagnation Advisory issued December 16 at 8:09PM PST until December 18 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST SUNDAY... ...AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog, along with slick spots in localized freezing fog. For the Air Stagnation Advisory, poor air quality. * WHERE...Foothills of the Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon. * WHEN...For the Dense Fog Advisory, until 10 AM PST Sunday. For the Air Stagnation Advisory, until 10 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility. Poor air quality may cause issues for people with respiratory problems. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Fog impacting I-84 and OR-11, with localized freezing fog possible as well.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you. People with respiratory illness should follow their physician`s advice for dealing with high levels of air pollution during periods of stagnant air. State air quality agencies highly recommend that no outdoor burning occur and that residential wood burning devices be limited as much as possible. According to state air quality agencies, prolonged periods of stagnant air can hold pollutants close to the ground where people live and breathe. Check with your local burn agency for any current restrictions in your area.

area.areaDesc: Foothills of the Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon
